titles.title: A bill to designate the plaza to be constructed on the Federal Triangle property in Washington, D.C., as the "Woodrow Wilson Plaza".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4931)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 219.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Committee on Public Works + Transportation discharged.
Mr. Mineta asked unanimous consent to discharge from committees and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 4/27/1993--Introduced. Designates the plaza to be constructed on the Federal Triangle property in Washington, D.C., as the Woodrow Wilson Plaza.
